text: hello and welcome to community chats i'm
your host ali hammer and today we're
joined with julia the co-founder and ceo
of great rap julia thank you so much for
joining us today can you start by
telling our audience a little bit about
great rap
yeah thanks for having me uh basically
so great wrap uh is a company that i
co-founded with my husband jordy and i
uh we make home compostable stretch wrap
from food waste
so we started the business about three
years ago um i was working in
architecture and jordi was making wine
and we were just seeing an incredible
amount of plastic waste um in our jobs
like i would choose the most beautiful
sustainable timber and it would show up
on site but it would still be wrapped in
all of this horrible petroleum-based
plastic
so we saw this huge problem and we knew
the technology existed uh but we just
sort of couldn't find a product that we
could use ourselves so we decided to
start great wrap
yeah that was three years ago now we've
got a solar powered factory on the
mornington peninsula in victoria we've
got a rapidly growing team and we're
continuing to sort of research ways in
which we can improve our processes so
that we can take food waste
and convert it into a biopolymer that we
can then use to eventually like put an
end to petroleum-based plastics
um so we've started with cling wrap
and we're looking to move into
your pillow packaging and and
trays that you'll see like pretty much
anything you'll see on the shelf um will
eventually be made by us
well that is so cool and i love that
your factory is solar powered and that
you have this massive vision to
completely rid the world of plastic it's
incredible your company is amazing
so julia there is a lot of packaging out
there um you know terms that are thrown
around but how do we know
as a consumer if you know the packaging
is good or bad per se
totally it's a great question and a bit
of a learning curve that we've been on
ourselves as well since we started
um so there's a lot of confusion i think
between the terms biodegradable
and home compostable
and i think the important one to know is
so basically when something says it's
biodegradable it's still made from an
oil based product the only difference is
an organic additive is sort of mixed
into the mixture and what that does is
it means that when the product is
exposed to sunlight and water and things
like that it'll break down faster
but uh it still breaks down into
tiny micro plastics which i'm sure we've
all heard about by now
so
home compostable which is what great
wrap is it actually means that the
product itself breaks down into carbon
water and biomass in in a anaerobic
environment so
even if it goes to landfill it'll still
break down into carbon water leaving no
nasties behind so i think if you're
looking for a product it's really really
important that you look for a home
compostable one yeah that makes sense
but why are compostable materials the
future packaging
uh look i think they're the future of
packaging because in a lot of instances
you know
obviously we promote uh replacing
plastic with reusable containers and
things like that but unfortunately in
some instances like freight there isn't
a reusable alternative um so
really like without completely
reinventing the way we ship things
across the world plastic would still
exist if there wasn't an alternative
like that for example so we just thought
if we could keep using a product the way
we do but reinvent it so it's able to
sort of disappear at the end of its life
uh we thought that was a great solution
i think the work that we're doing is
really the future of packaging too
because we're actually working um
really directly with monash university
and we're going to have a product very
soon that's marine degradable as well so
if a little bit of great wrap blows off
the back of a truck and ends up in the
ocean which
we hope it won't um it'll break down
there as well so we really think this is
the future just because it means that
you know there's no more plastic in our
oceans in our tummies we're not using
petroleum uh as a as a base you know
using food waste is also an incredibly
um
great opportunity to be capitalizing on
because we've got so much of it at the
moment
yeah i totally agree and you know
consumers are definitely becoming a lot
more conscious about the environment so
i feel like personally the companies who
you know don't change and step up so it
all will simply be left behind
so julia if i walk into a supermarket in
10 years time or if i were to look at a
landfill what would it be that i would
be seeing
yeah so i think in
10 years time you'll walk into a
supermarket
and you will see what might look to you
like a very similar site that you see
now but every product that's wrapped in
plastic or comes in a little
safe food pouch
is actually made from a polymer that
we've made at great wrap that's made
from food waste and that will break down
in water so i think if you then walked
out of the supermarket and crossed the
road over to the landfill you'd see
something that was a hopefully a lot
smaller than what it is now
um i think it's really exciting we're
really really looking forward to a
future where petroleum plastic doesn't
exist and so what that means is
there just won't be the amount of waste
that we've seen you know every piece of
plastic that was made um since the 60s
still still exists somewhere in a
landfill and we just really want to
mitigate that problem julia first of all
thank you so much for coming on the show
today but secondly thank you so much for
creating this incredible product
selling it on the amazon platform and
honestly for talking to us today
the work that you're doing is so
incredible and i really hope in 10 years
time we we do see what exactly what
you've talked about so thank you so much
for joining me today and if anyone has
